pros: The leadership really cares about the employees and students
cons: Sometimes the long hours can be tough

review_title: More than happy to have you worked insane hours and then once you have produced, they terminate you to "save money."
pros: The only pros would be the incredible colleagues.
cons: Most everything is a con. A very pariah-like culture.

review_title: Great school for entry into the profession of Nursing
pros: Educators that care In-Person learning Targeted NCLEX prep
cons: Low pay, expensive benefits, little upward mobility

review_title: Hired and expected me to train my replacement.
job_title: Math Adjunct Instructor in Cleveland, OH
pros: Can't really give any due to how they treated me
cons: Introduced me to my replacement and expected me to train them. I needed the job and had no idea.

pros: Fun events, enjoyable staff, love the students
cons: things can change quickly and be slightly unorganized

pros:
It’s good for students who can’t get accepted anywhere else. 

Ok for first teaching job.
cons:
Pay
Dean is mildly racist

pros: Nice people to work with!
cons: Overloaded with work! Dean of school was not helpful!

pros: Coworkers and students are great. Leadership cares about students even if students don't always feel that way. There is a three week break between quarters which is nice.
cons: It can be hectic not knowing what your exact schedule is quarter to quarter so that you know how to plan your life.

pros: Friendly staff, flexible work schedule/hours
cons: Low quality education offered, unorganized management, old school systems

job_title: Human Resources Business Partner in Columbus, OH
pros: This company cares about our employees. The only people we care about more are our students. There is a family culture here at Hondros College of Nursing. We truly are One Team, One Mission.
cons: When I first started, I had never worked in a College setting before. It was a lot to get used to.

pros: You will meet really good people at your own campus.
cons: The administrators of the college (not the campus) are unqualified, unprofessional, and rude. Their micromanagement is extreme, although none of them have any experience running a college.

pros: Great co-workers and can feel like your making a difference in the students lives
cons: Pay increases are a struggle and room to move can be limited

pros: Extremely passionate people to work with! We have a lot of responsibility and autonomy, but it always makes the effort worth while when you have a great group of people all working towards the same goal.
cons: We are a growing organization and have experienced a lot of changes in recent years due to the adding of new campus locations and even a new program. Our curriculum is always adapting to meet challenges, and requires continuous engagement to stay on top of the best ways to provide the best possible student experience. The company offers company paid staff and faculty development on an annual and quarterly basis, but

review_title: A growing company with positive changes
pros: The company seems to be working hard to develop cutting age curriculum and train faculty members to deliver it properly to the students. They really do try to put the students first, and that is what education should be about.
cons: Leadership can sometimes be hard to talk to about personal circumstances, but do try to be fair across the board with staff and faculty.

job_title: Adjunct Clinical Instructor in West Chester, OH
pros:
Flexible schedule - can request which days to work
Happy co-workers - nursing is a profession in which you tend to find lots of jaded co-workers. I haven't met one co-worker that didn't genuinely enjoy working here. Everyone is extremely nice and welcoming.
cons:
10 weeks a year un paid between semesters & breaks.
Compensation for level 1 clinical instructor is not a great wage - some of my students make almost as much as new LPNs.

pros: Great coworkers and  management, and  teaching assignments.  Good relationships with clinical sites - hospitals and nursing homes. Site visits by management.  Immediate problem resolution. 2 weeks paid vacation at the end of every quarter. All holidays off.
cons: low pay, high turnover rate.  Occasional Saturday clinicals for make-ups.

pros: You are really able to be engaged with the students because it is a smaller campus. No one micro manages you as long as you complete your work.
cons: Things are done at the last minute with little preparation.

pros: People really are great to work with. There has been a lot of change with curriculum and leadership, but things are really getting on track.
cons: Salary starting out could be higher, but promotions seem pretty frequent because of the amount of growth.

pros: Wonderful co-workers, nice facility, good future outlook of company
cons: Some office areas are very small

review_title: Horrible Place to Work (College of Nursing)
pros: The students were great and interested in learning.
cons: Cliques of faculty members; faculty teaching quality is poor; extremely low-paying when compared to other colleges in the area; faculty suggestions are dismissed; disorganized administration; high turnover; no paid time off for any reason except bereavement (all other time off is unpaid and risks losing your position).

job_title: Nurse Faculty I in Cleveland, OH
pros: Excellent staff and DON.  Everyone supported students and one another. Good benefits.
cons: There were no cons to this position.

job_title: Faculty Instructor in New Albany, OH
pros: Friendly colleagues, warm and nice facility.
cons: Way too much work for the salary.  You are never done with your job.  Unable to take time off when you need, only when classes are not in session.  Unorganized throughout.

job_title: Clinical Nursing Instructor in Westerville, OH
pros: Enjoyable experience working with students to teach them the nursing profession
cons: Long drive from home and limited hours for part time employees

pros: Nice peer group to work with
cons: Frequent additional hours expected without compensation for additional time. Poor benefits and insurance

pros: Have the opportunity to develop as a nurse educator.
cons: Need to work on life-balance

job_title: Director of NCLEX Success: Southern Region in Fairborn, OH
pros: Cares about service provided students
cons: Across 5 campuses gets complicated

job_title: Anonymous Employee in West Chester, OH
pros: You get an additional 15 mins during your 1 hour lunch break when you do a bank run -
cons: Not guaranteed for a Raise, Favoritism, No Team-work,Lack of work ethics, Time Management, Underpaid.

review_title: A Mom & Pop Shop that thinks it is more....but isn
pros: Nice facilities. Many great co-workers.
cons: Lack of leadership bordering on crazy at times
